intro: Glandularia ballsii, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant features glandular hairs on its stems and leaves, which secrete oils and contribute to its aromatic properties. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. Glandularia ballsii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
